# Program

1. [**Hypothesis testing**](https://aldosolari.github.io/SI2/docs/hyptest.html): Darwin data, $p$-values, Neyman-Pearson lemma, duality with confidence intervals
    - TBD

2. [**Multiple testing and selective inference**](https://aldosolari.github.io/SI2/docs/selinf.html): 
Replicability crisis, case studies: U.S. economy-politics,  jellybeans-acne and the dead salmon, error rates: FWER, FDR and FDP
    - TBD


3. **Methods for FWER and FDR control**: Golub data, Bonferroni, Holm, Westfall \& Young, Benjamini-Hochberg, confidence interval for selected parameters and false coverage rate

4. **All-resolutions inference**: fMRI data, closed testing, simultaneous confidence bounds for the FDP

5. **The variable selection problem**: Best subset selection algorithm for linear models, post selection inference, model confidence set


All of the course material is on the [github repository](https://github.com/aldosolari/SI2).
